contentData.title: Introduction
contentData.heading: Introduction
contentData.paragraph: Your company name and logo, along with contact details. You can add a picture that evokes positive emotion. Use warm colours.

inputFieldsData.label: A. Upload company logo
inputFieldsData.tip: You should upload your latest company logo

inputFieldsData.label: C. Company tagline
inputFieldsData.tip: Not important, But it should be very crux

footerData.hintText: Don’t worry if you make some changes, you can always come back later.

contentData.title: Problem
contentData.heading: Problem
contentData.paragraph: There are plenty of EdTech startups out there. Convey the problem that you have discovered as a unique one.

inputFieldsData.label: What Problem do you solve?
inputFieldsData.tip: The problem should be relatable and phrased within one sentence only.

contentData.title: Solution
contentData.heading: Solution
contentData.paragraph: Make a bold claim about your solution and give information about what you came up with. This is a very important slide.

inputFieldsData.label: A. 1st Question on Slide 3
inputFieldsData.tip: It will decide if your potential investor will follow your presentation for the next 5 minutes or if he’ll wait for you to finish the pitch.

contentData.title: Market
contentData.heading: Market
contentData.paragraph: If the market is huge, there is a fair chance that your revenue can be huge as well.

inputFieldsData.label: What market do you serve
inputFieldsData.tip: Provide relevant facts about your target market.

contentData.title: Business Model
contentData.heading: Business Model
contentData.paragraph: Answers the question about how you will generate revenue with your product.

inputFieldsData.label: A. 1st Question on Slide 5
inputFieldsData.tip: Provide all the information that could be of interest to your investors.

contentData.title: Product in action
contentData.heading: Product in action
contentData.paragraph: Include feedback and the impact of your product on your customers, backed by data.

inputFieldsData.label: What is your Product?
inputFieldsData.tip: A brief description of your product

inputFieldsData.label: Have you gained any traction
inputFieldsData.tip: This could include any awards, recognitions, social media followers/subscribers.

contentData.title: Competition
contentData.heading: Competition
contentData.paragraph: Edtech sector is huge, therefore, there is no dearth of competitors.

inputFieldsData.label: Do you have any competetors?
inputFieldsData.tip: Include your closest competitors in this slide.

inputFieldsData.label: Who is you team?
inputFieldsData.tip: You can include the previous experience of your key team members and any critical skills that are essential to the business.

contentData.title: Product Roadmap
contentData.heading: Product Roadmap
contentData.paragraph: This slide is very important to include if you want the investors to take you seriously. Prove that what you’re presenting today is just the beginning.

inputFieldsData.label: What is your Product Roadmap
inputFieldsData.tip: If you have future products in the pipeline or you have some vision in mind, let the investors know about it.

contentData.title: Financials/Projections
contentData.heading: Financials/Projections
contentData.paragraph: Show at least 3 years of projections.

inputFieldsData.label: What are your Projections
inputFieldsData.tip: Attach charts that show sales, total customers, total expenses, and profits.

contentData.title: Investment
contentData.heading: Investment
contentData.paragraph: Give a small insight about how much funds you need and where you will be using those funds.

inputFieldsData.label: How much funds are you looking to raise
inputFieldsData.tip: Instead of putting a specific amount that you are raising, put a range. For example, if you would like to raise $10 million, put a range between $7 million and $10 million.

contentData.title: Investment Purpose
contentData.heading: Investment Purpose
contentData.paragraph: Give a small insight about how much funds you need and where you will be using those funds.

inputFieldsData.label: Where will you use these funds
inputFieldsData.tip: Give a small insight about where you will be using the funds.
